meanings.sent1: She found a nubbin of cheese in the fridge.
meanings.sent2: The bird pecked at the nubbin of bread on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored the nubbin of nut in its secret stash.
meanings.sent4: The nubbin of clay was the missing piece in her pottery project.
meanings.sent5: The nubbin of information helped solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: A small, undeveloped or immature part or growth
meanings.sent1: The farmer noticed a nubbin on the corn cob.
meanings.sent2: The tiny nubbin of a leaf sprouted on the plant.
meanings.sent3: The nubbin of an idea popped into her head during the meeting.
meanings.sent4: His talent was just a nubbin waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The nubbin of a smile appeared on her face.
